questions.question_text: Which configuration setting is used to configure PLAR on a SIP phone?
What is the purpose of configuring locations in a Cisco Webex dial plan?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Webex Locations are settings configured in the Webex Control Hub for Webex Calling that allow you to group together any users and devices using the calling feature that have the same dialing behaviors based on their location. This can be configured based on any location that will have a Local Gateway assigned to it.
A. and C. are incorrect since the concept of Webex Location is different of that on-premise CUCM Location.
B. is incorrect. Webex Location just connect to a Webex Calling SBC using a Local Gateway with a trunk, it does not have to do with how many datacenters are in the Webex Cloud.

Selected Answer: D
Should be D

Selected Answer: D
NOT A. 
In Webex dial plan there is a concept of location, but it does not have any CAC capabilities, Webex Calling locations concept group together devices or users sharing the same geographical location (address) or sites, PSTN access (on-prem or cloud connected PSTN), main number, site code, PSTN steering digit (PSTN Access Code) etc.

Based on the above correct answer is D

https://community.cisco.com/t5/collaboration-blogs/demystifying-webex-calling-dial-plan-and-call-routing/ba-p/4949091

choices.B: to choose how many Webex data centers to use for redundancy
choices.A: to specify the maximum bandwidth to allocate per Webex call
choices.D: to allow the use of an existing PSTN provider for local calls
choices.C: to conserve bandwidth by selecting the closest data center

In August 2016, Cisco released version X8.9, which allowed for registrations directly to the Expressway Core. 
Then:
There have been several more upgrades since X8.9, and the Cisco Expressway Edge can now support both H.323 and SIP registration. Proxied registration still supports only SIP.
